```{r}
# range in R
x=c(5,2,7,9,4)
range(x)
#[1] 2 9

# range in R - the NA issue
x=c(5,2,NA,9,4)
range(x,na.rm=FALSE)
#[1] NA NA

# range in r - using na.rm to clean up results 
range(x,na.rm=TRUE)
#[1] 2 9

# range in R - vectors with alphabetical data
x=c("c","r","e","a","g","e","r")
range(x)
#[1] "a" "r"
```

```{r}
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- NULL
system.time(for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z <- c(z, x[i] + y[i])
})
z 
```

```{r}
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- NULL
system.time(for (i in seq_along(x)) {
  z <- c(z, x[i] + y[i])
})
z 
```


```{r}
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- NULL
system.time(for (i in range(x)) {
  z <- c(z, x[i] + y[i])
})
z 
```

```{r}
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- vector(length=10)
system.time(for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z[i] <- x[i] + y[i]
})
z
```

```{r}
x <- 1:10
y <- 11:20
z <- vector(mode = "double", length=10)
system.time(for (i in 1:length(x)){
  z[i] <- x[i] + y[i]
})
z
```
